Posts.Content: pleasehelpmee wrote: hi, My mom is 59 and has never had bc, but she has had a few scares.In 2014 she had a biopsy (she had had one before this I think) that came up negative for cancer. But today she randomly noticed that the skin around that previous incision is slightly puckered. Can previous biopsies result in puckering? And has puckering ever led to a normal non cancer result? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Puckering/dimpling--Can it be caused by a previous biopsy? pleasehelpmee MelissaDallas
